H0.text: Observing whether plants lack true stems, roots, or leaves is how a student can determine which plants around a pond are nonvascular.

H1.text: Examining the plants for spores is how a student can determine which plants around a pond are nonvascular.

H2.text: Counting the number of leaves on each stalk is how a student can determine which plants around a pond are nonvascular.

H3.text: Noticing whether the plants are near rocks is how a student can determine which plants around a pond are nonvascular.

A4.text: Non-vascular plants have sporophytes that produce spores
